TopicTitle: Who are you fav KSP youtubers?

Articles.Content: Robbaz and Scott Manley.

My favourite Tubers are Scott Manley, Kurt, Solargamer, Abyssal Lurker, DxGamer, Danny, Elysium and HOC.

But my most favourite was PixelStache but his last Video was released a Month ago.

Nontheless, he has some pretty cool designs for stations and ships.

For Example (craftfile in Video description):

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j4EZ_gxnfWo&list=UU1B34nTc0Ctr3ZNG1mzeW5w&feature=share&index=4

Edited January 15, 2014 by MalfunctionM1Ke

EnterElysium, Themattdennis16, and Scott Manley.

EDIT: and Danny2462, how could I forget??
I have to say Scott Manley. He is interesting, you learn a lot and his scottish accent makes it only better.

I've seen a lot of prominent names in this thread but I think two are really missing:

5th Horseman

Don Lorenzo

Both of them could use more subscribers and they deserve them a hell of a lot more than some of the big channels!

I mostly watch Robbaz and Scott Manley. Been watching Robbaz for a whilem, but I picked up on his KSP vids last December (2012). Been watching Scott Manley since March or something. I also sometimes watch kurtjmac (used to watch back in 0.18/0.19) and Danny2462 is nice, too. Can't forget Macey Dean, HOCGaming, or EnterElysium.

I found KSP on account of Kurt, but it can be a little frustrating watching him detach parachutes while landing on Duna for no reason, etc.

Danny2462 is hilarious.

Scott Manley is awesome.

Macey Dean is good, but I don't know if he is posting anymore.

Flixx, I think you nailed it ! They're all good in their own areas of expertise, however Mr. Manley, (to me) can be a little annoying with his post-recorded narrations. Kurtjmac makes his commentary as he's playing, which I think, deserves a lot of credit. No, he's not very technically savvy and he admits it, which adds to the humorous entertainment value of his videos. Yes Scott Manley knows his stuff and all, but sometimes strikes me as being a bit of a blow hard. The first time I saw one of Danny's vids I laughed my *ss off! ( I think it's the goofy music)

Scott Manley, just for being awesome!!

4KbShort for teaching me some things i didn't know, and because things can get very funny sometimes!
I mainly watch Danny and Scott. Gonna have to take a peek at the other suggestions in this thread.

4kbShort, because i first found KSP because of him.

Danny2462, because he is downright hilarious. Not even SQUAD can comprehend his shenanigans.

And Scott Manley, because he is relatively intriguing.

I could echo all the above, and I watch most of those that've been mentioned (when I have time). Yet a name I haven't seen mentioned is ThrashingMadPL. I understand maybe 30 word of Polish, but I really enjoy his KSP stuff. (This game is rather transcendent anyway.)

I do wish Macey Dean was still around....
My favorite is either xXLeGoldfishXx or Enterelysium.

(In addition to my first post)

I forgot about Enter Elysium. He has pretty good videos as well. World War K was fun to watch.

Mainly Scott Manley, HOC Gaming and Kurt. Scott because he's really a good storyteller & teacher. HOC Gaming because he's got a certain practical sense in his designs that I appreciate and Kurt because he's much closer to a "good but not insanely good" player which makes me relate to him better.

I'm not getting into Scott's Interstellar Quest the same why I got into his reusable space program, even though Interstellar Quest is the spiritual child of the former.

Scot manly for educational/ amazing feats of engineering. danny2462 for utterly ridiculous stuff. Finaly Robbaz for glORioUs viking teknology and some of the most entertaining commentary and fails on youtube.
*profile pic*

In no particular order :

  • Scott Manley because his quiet and soothing voice is a welcome change when I get back home after work. I also like the Scottish accent and the slightly rolling "r"s, it makes everything sound epic to my French ears.
  • Danny2462 for his awesome editing skills and... fascinating music choices.
  • I've also seen a few Abyssal Lurker videos, and they seem to be great sources of engineering inspiration. Also like his accent, it's a welcome change from the mostly American stuff that are broadcast on French TV.

This tread is an amazing source of more good youtubers to follow, I took note of a few channels that I'll have to check!

I'll also add Robbaz to my list of KSP youtubers that I watch as soon as a video of theirs comes out.

I do watch others, but Robbaz and Danny are my favourites.

Mine has gotta be Thorlp with his KSP IRD and ISD series. If you like insane rockets and space planes he's your guy. Heck his whole series is called insane rockets/science division. So you know it's gonna be good!

Scott Manley, kurtjmac (I wish he posted more often), Thor (just how did he manage to get that off the ground?!), Zisteau (I think his Minmus lander out-masses my entire space program to date), and 5th horseman.

-Scott Manley (do I even have to explain?)

-Danny2462 (for delivering fantastic, funny, and witty KSP content)

-Robbaz (GLORIOUS!)

-kurtjmac (He still has trouble landing on the Mun after 97 episodes )

EDIT: -ThorLP! Of course, how could I have forgotten! *Please don't smite me, Thor...*

Edited January 17, 2014 by turkwinif

Scott Manley and Zisteau

Scott because of his intricate knowledge of pretty much anything to do with orbits and physics and all that good stuff

Zisteau because he doesn't know enough to know that it's crazy, so he does it anyway!

HOC and Danny.

Harv because I like his commentaries and he has an unusually pleasing voice. (He should become an advertiser when he is older btw.)

And danny because he effs around, is hillarious, and his great use of captions.

Kurtjmac makes far to few videos to be on of the best KSP youtubers and i don't really understand why he is in the Special thanks.

Because he was the first 'big' youtuber to make KSP videos.
